{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 36-year-old with ER positive breast cancer and one positive axillary lymph node who underwent breast conservation therapy and chemotherapy. The recommended follow-up for this patient would be routine clinical examination 3 monthly in the first year with an annual mammogram. This is the standard follow-up protocol for patients who have undergone breast conservation therapy. Annual bone scan and assessment of tumor markers are not routinely recommended for this patient population. Liver function tests every 6 months are not necessary unless there are specific indications or symptoms of liver involvement.", "answer_choice": "C"}
